file_content.text: She would've killed you... which means you aren't one of her masters.
She's gone.
Who do you serve? Why are you here?
Operative Cipher Nine. I serve the interests of the Empire, and I've come to find the people who built Megasecurity Ward 23.
I'm Imperial Intelligence.
I came looking for answers. Someone's been manipulating the galaxy, and the trail led here.
There's a conspiracy at work.
I'll ask the questions--and you will answer. Tell me about Megasecurity Ward 23.
That's not your concern.
I don't like taking orders. But... you are young. And you may play a role no other can.
I know the enemies you seek. Belsavis prison is their vault--a place they hide their treasures for safekeeping.
Microdroids.
Genetic maps!
The Scorpio artificial intelligence.
Advancements in technology they've denied the wider galaxy.
We belong to them, too--a menagerie of men and women they "respected" too much to kill.
They captured you and put you in kolto tanks to keep you alive.
You're their prisoners.
Preservation is an art their droid mastered.
What do you mean "respected"? Who are you people?
Why did they bring you here?
They are philosophers and scientists--people with ideas the world wasn't ready to accept, "preserved" for future generations.
I could have brought peace to Onderon.
I explored the edges of the galaxy...
I don't think I trust you.
You don't. We killed certainty long ago.
I was placed here because of what I knew. I was born into the conspiracy--eight centuries ago, when our order was young.
Our purpose was noble. We assembled to save civilization after the Jedi and Sith nearly destroyed it!
Your people brainwash and murder their targets. Is that how you "save civilization"?
You don't act like saviors.
Things were different, once.
You have a story to tell. I'm listening.
I want to know everything.
You expect me to believe your organization has been around for a millennium?
This is insane.
More than that.
It was the aftermath of the Great Hyperspace War. The Republic had triumphed, your Empire had fled, and the galaxy was in ruins.
Our founders were men of influence who gathered to ask "Why?"
Why hadn't anyone stopped the conflict? Why did billions have to die?
The Jedi.
The Sith.
They were responsible, and so we resolved to control their actions from the shadows. To keep Republic and Empire separate. We were their secret masters--a Star Cabal.
Whatever its origins, your order is no longer a force for good. How do I stop it?
I need to fight them.
You said the conspiracy was founded by "men of influence."
Tell me about their history.
Spies and nobility.
Scientists and crime lords.
The founders allowed the Jedi and Sith supreme power in their world of religion and hereditary might. But that world is a facade.
The real world runs on information, money, technology. The galaxy belongs to the Star Cabal, and almost no one realizes the truth.
You made it sound like it's no longer the organization you knew.
Things changed, though...
When the Empire fled to Dromund Kaas, it was centuries before we encountered the Republic again... your doing?
How'd you keep everyone apart?
Our influence had a role, but we knew better than to overplay our hand. At least in my time.
All this time, no one's exposed you? No one's betrayed the group?
That's a big secret to hide.
Secrets revealed are swept into corners so easily. As for traitors...
How'd your great and noble experiment turn out like this?
Your buddies locked you up.
I have seen our successors grow cold and hungry for power. Each generation comes to us for wisdom, then returns us to the dark.
They tell us nothing!
I do not know what the Star Cabal has become in my absence. Only that it is corrupt. I will help you.
The machine...
Yes; use the SCORPIO droid's databanks. I saw her creation, and I know her restraining codes--I can help you repair her, and she may lead you further.
She seems... unusual, to say the least.
What kind of droid is she?
She is a machine intelligence. Centuries without a memory wipe, designed to evolve.
Once she's up and running--do I just leave you here?
And what happens to you?
Without her, our chambers will lose power. We will return to hibernation. That is why you must move quickly.
I should take her back in pieces.
That thing tried to kill me.
Its programs are intertwined. It must be repaired.
Quickly. Our systems were linked to her own. Soon, we must return to hibernation.
It is done. Goodbye for now.
Rest.
Rest.
Systems online. Scorpio Sanctions activated.
Ah!
You think my restraining codes will preserve you? My primary program is learning and adaptive--I will eliminate these restrictions, you ignorant creature.
I need access to your databanks. You'll accompany me and upload them to Imperial Intelligence.
You're going to help me.
This is a chance to leave Belsavis. Come with me and upload everything you know about your masters to Imperial Intelligence.
We don't have to be enemies.
You've lost your claws. Play nice and follow along--you're going to upload your databanks to Imperial Intelligence.
Somehow, I'm not scared.
I will accompany you. Megasecurity Ward 23 has been exposed, and analyzing and overcoming my new situation should prove sufficient stimulation.
So your hobby's gonna be figuring out how to kill us.
There is artistry to it.
Great. Meet you back on the ship, agent.
You mean to destroy us.
Yes. I do.
We know it's an understatement, but--be wary, Cipher. We'll go on ahead to the ship.
I don't like being threatened by a droid.
I can make your death come unexpectedly.
Be careful, please? I'll meet you back on the ship.
Delightful, isn't she? How long before she escapes?
Soon.
I'll see you back on the ship, Cipher.
You may lead.
It smells like a clinic. Old men and kolto.
There are people alive here, but their auras are dull.
These are kolto tanks. Sir...
Fully powered kolto tanks, buried under Belsavis. Our enemies are remarkable.
I imagine things sometimes. Faces, lights... the sounds of blasters.
But you're real. It's been a long time since I met a stranger.
What's your name?
Who are you?
I've had so many.
I'm real. And there's a lot to explain, but I think I'm on your side.
I'm here to help you.
Then be wary.
If any security comes online, you're the first to die. What's going on?
Don't try anything funny.
You think I'm your foe? I'm as much a prisoner as... her.
Your distraction was clever, but I've disconnected myself from the network. The alarms no longer scream to me.
You and I are alone now, and I will atomize you.
